channel.title: ::setstats
channel.description: Ok im trying piss hard to make a command like this but everytime i test it out, it wont decrease exp and it wont ever get 99 def, never goes past 99 for some reason.. Can anyone provide me with some tips or help?

item.title: ::setstats
item.dc:creator: @Thr0ne Thr0ne
item.description:
@Thr0ne wrote:

No you don’t. There’s already an experience array in Formulae (actually I think there are two), and depending on what source you’re using, XP from 100-115 is already added. There’s also already an int method in there called experienceToLevel() which you’re using to get the correct level to set your new levels to. You need to fix the forloop inside that method, cause right now it’ll only loop for as long as you’re under 98.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: ::setstats
item.dc:creator: @Thr0ne Thr0ne
item.description:
@Thr0ne wrote:

        if (args.length < 3, args.length > 3) {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("::setstats att def str");
		return;
	}
	
	for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
		player.setCurStat(i, Integer.parseInt(args[i]));
		player.setMaxStat(i, Integer.parseInt(args[i]));
		player.setExp(i, Formulae.lvlToXp(Integer.parseInt(args[i])));
	}
			
	double hitsXP = 0;
	for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
		hitsXP += player.getExp(i);
	hitsXP /= 3;
	int newHP = Formulae.experienceToLevel((int)Math.floor(hitsXP));
	player.setCurStat(3, newHP);
	player.setMaxStat(3, newHP);
	player.setExp(3, (int)Math.floor(hitsXP));
			
	int newCB = Formulae.getCombatLevel(player.getMaxStats());
	if (newCB != player.getCombatLevel())
		player.setCombatLevel(newCB);
			
	player.getActionSender().sendStats();
	player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Stats set successfully.");
	return;

I’m going to assume you know where to put it. Fix the forloop in experienceToLevel if you want to make it go past 99.

Read full topic

item.title: ::setstats
item.dc:creator: @auroa auroa
item.description:
@auroa wrote:

[quote=“cr0ss, post:2, topic:223944”]If you haven’t coded in higher level support, then no.

The command gives you certain amount exp you need for level. And with that you “advance levels”.
So if it is set in server that at 81 exp you get level 2, then when you do ::setstats 1 1 2, you get actually just 81 exp to mysql table and server reads it as level 2.[/quote]
OOOhh, i think i got it nowww, thanks.

But how will they no that ::setstats goes in the order attack defence strength is my real dilema.

Read full topic

item.title: ::setstats
item.dc:creator: @cr0ss cr0ss
item.description:
@cr0ss wrote:

If you haven’t coded in higher level support, then no.

The command gives you certain amount exp you need for level. And with that you “advance levels”.
So if it is set in server that at 81 exp you get level 2, then when you do ::setstats 1 1 2, you get actually just 81 exp to mysql table and server reads it as level 2.

Read full topic
